titleInfo.title: McKinley High School Oral History Project: History of the School
titleInfo.subTitle: Frankie B. Chrisentery oral history interview, 1995

name.description: Frankie B. Chrisentery was born in East Baton Rouge Parish, La. She attended McKinley Senior High School in Baton Rouge, graduating in 1944. She went to Grambling State University, then Southern University for two years each. Chrisentery earned a master's degree from Indiana University and worked for many years as an educator in several East Baton Rouge Parish schools.

subject.topic: African American high school students--Louisiana--Baton Rouge.

mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries Special Collections (http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special)
mods.accessCondition: Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright is retained by Louisiana State University in accordance with U.S. copyright laws.

"E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments. See instructions for ordering reprints of this audio here: http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special/services/duplication.html Mention the ""Item number"" or ""Item URL"" in your request. "
mods.abstract: Chrisentery primarily discusses her memories as a student at McKinley High School in the early 1940s. She recalls her favorite teachers, school principals, fellow students, clothing and hair styles, academics, extracurricular activities, shortcomings of the school facilities in the 1940s, and other topics. She discusses some of the prominent graduates and the need to keep the legacy of McKinley High alive. She offers advice to McKinley graduates and contrasts their opportunities against the limited opportunities she faced as a graduate.
